file_content.text: You're the boss.
Jaesa insists it'll change hands again. The Republic won't let Corellia go easily.
The Twi'lek's a surprise. No military training, but she holds her own out there.
We work well together. Lot easier without Quinn breathing down our necks.
Quinn's only useful contribution was getting himself killed.
Good riddance.
Rest of the time, it was red tape and aggravation.
Quinn kept the crew in line. It's unfortunate he had to die.
And less efficient.
Gave me some competition. Still better off without him.
You'll serve me whether you like each other or not.
I could care less.
Anyone else betrays me, and they'll meet the captain's fate.
He asked for it.
The business end of my blaster. Hope no one else is that stupid.
Gotta take a hard line. Traitors can't be tolerated.
You shouldn't speak ill of our glorious dead.
Quinn died a hero.
Took it like a man, give him that much. I made it hurt.
Been getting to know the crew. Jaesa's soft everywhere but battle. Wonder if all Jedi have that kind of power.
Been getting to know the crew. Never guessed Jaesa used to be a Jedi. Girl's starting to scare me. I like it.
Can't understand a word the Talz says, but glad he's on our side. And for no training, the Twi'lek does alright.
Nobody has ever betrayed me twice. Just saying.
All I see is whatever, whoever I'm supposed to kill. Makes every planet look the same.
My lord. Dropped my things in the crew bunks. Good ship.
Quinn's already briefed me. I'm handling demolitions and heavy firepower support.
Didn't know the captain ran things around here. I'd rather take my orders direct.
Quinn handles the details, but you answer to me.
I run this ship, not him.
Fine with me. Just keep Captain Protocol off my back.
Do you have a problem with the captain?
You don't like Quinn?
By-the-book types get under my skin.
You will do as Quinn says. Is that direct enough?
He has my authority.
Noted.
Moff Hurdenn was all about regulations, too. War Trust did a lot more damage than they should have.
Hurdenn didn't think a soldier could strategize. Proved him wrong.
Hurdenn was a fool to ignore your natural talents.
He should have listened.
Moff Hurdenn is your superior. You will show him respect.
Enough of the back talk.
Noted.
In what capacity did you serve him?
What were your duties?
Special ops, holdout squads, suicide missions. Whatever no one else could do.
Doesn't matter much now. I'm here, and Hurdenn's stuck on Taris.
Give me the freedom he didn't, and you'll see results.
You won't act independently. You follow my orders.
I'm still in command.
Course. Just hope you're flexible on the "how."
I hope you have the talent to back up your talk.
[Flirt] So you say.
Just say the word. I'll show you what I can do.
The others will tell you I accept only the best.
You'll do well here.
Shouldn't have any problem fitting in, then.
There are many soldiers willing to take your place.
Don't disappoint me.
Then they can pry it from my cold, dead hands.
Been thinking. You'll always need someone in the Empire. Someone who knows how to get things done.
Was hoping I could stay on board. Make this assignment a little more permanent.
You're mine until you fall in battle. Or I dispose of you.
It already is.
Rather die here than serve someone else.
As long as you're useful, you'll remain on my crew.
No promises.
You've earned your freedom. Come or go as you please.
That's up to you.
No reason to leave. Long way down from here.
You've got a good group. But more will come--apprentices, officers, your own battalions. They'll need training.
Leave them to me. You'll have the strongest army the Empire's ever seen.
Serve me well, and that may be your reward.
You'll have to earn it.
Looking forward to it. My lord.
You'll go farther than any Imperial before you.
Sounds excellent.
Already there, my lord.
Betray me, and I'll destroy you.
I expect loyalty.
Don't worry, I know my limits.
Got a comm from the team. The Bastion's back up and running, with Imperial flags.
Course, Quinn had to run his mouth. Thinks Corellia's unstable, we'll never hold it.
Jealous, if you ask me. Our assault on the Bastion's part of history now.
Under the circumstances, it was an adequate performance.
If you say so.
Wasn't sure how the team would do. Did a lot better than "adequate."
Perhaps the Empire will reinstate black ops permanently.
Congratulations.
Your mouth to their ears, my lord. But first duty's to you.
Swear Arlos built that security system himself. Never seen Lorant command so many. And when that gate came down... Tanido's finest hour.
The Sith make history. Imperials are a footnote at best.
Not without me.
Noted.
Just like old times. Flexed a lot of forgotten muscles out there. Should improve my skills in the field.
This took time. I expect a return on my investment.
You better hope so.
What's a soldier without his brilliant commander, my lord?
I'd like to see your skills off the field. In private.
[Flirt] Show me.
As you command, my lord.
Satisfied?
Consider that part of your duties here.
Very much.
This post gets better all the time.
I expected more from a man like you.
Disappointed.
Better than Quinn would be. Tell you that much.
I've seen all I need to. Get back to work.
Good enough.
Whatever you say. Happy to serve.
What have you learned from storming the Bastion?
What kind of skills?
Accuracy, timing, coordination. Where the enemy's weak, and how to exploit it.
Forget your lost missions. I've indulged you long enough.
Back to business now.
Black ops earned its name at the Bastion. Appreciate the chance.
Gate's open, security's down, and their CO is dead. The Bastion belongs to the Empire.
Welcome to a black ops victory, my lord. Long odds, big prize, no survivors.
Black ops training has its merits. I'll see that you're all rewarded.
I'm impressed.
Look forward to that. The Bastion was no routine assault.
Were all your preparations worth the effort?
How did it go?
You couldn't have set foot on Corellia without me.
"Your" victory?
Sure I can work that off somehow.
The credit's all yours, my lord. Experience was enough for me.
Hit a few snags. Tanido's weapon lost power. Couple of Lorant's men died. Arlos tripped a system hacking in.
Took a bit of damage myself. Going to take some time to heal. Let you know when I'm up for a full debrief.
Got a secure message from General Rakton. You'll want to hear this.
My lord. I received Lieutenant Pierce's comm. I've reinstated black ops and excused the team from their prior assignments.
If all the preparations have been made, you have Imperial clearance for your assault on the Bastion.
Had a feeling this was it. Hard to believe we're finally making our move.
Play the rest. I want Rakton's full briefing.
Let's do it right.
We have no more time for preparations.
Are you ready?
Don't need any. Unless Rakton's got some surprises.
Don't get sentimental on me now, Pierce.
Get a hold of yourself.
Me? You must be thinking of Quinn.
Due to the massive Republic presence at the Bastion, we've made special arrangements to get Pierce's team within range.
You'll infiltrate a shuttle of Republic reinforcements headed for the area. We've already procured the necessary disguises.
Surprise is essential. Therefore, I must ask that you remain behind, my lord. Your presence would expose our plans.
He actually expects me to sit on the sidelines?
He must be joking.
He's right. There's no mistaking you for a Republic grunt.
I'm sure there's a Republic uniform in my size.
Expose our plans?
They'll have Jedi along. No uniform would hide your power.
Glad to hear it.
You've got your mission, and black ops has ours. Finally.
You made this assault possible, my lord. The credit is yours--should Pierce and his team succeed.
The Empire is trusting black ops with our victory. I hope it is not misplaced. General Rakton out.
The team has their instructions. Have to leave now if I'm going to make the rendezvous.
When the Bastion falls, the Republic will know our power.
You will do well.
So will the Empire. Just how I like it.
I'd better see Imperial colors on that building.
Don't embarrass me.
From the foundation to the rafters, my lord.
I won't be delayed by the General or the Bastion.
Make this quick.
Noted. Heading out.
Almost ready for the Bastion now. Security's the last wrinkle. Takes a good tech to deal with Republic systems.
Ours is Sergeant Arlos. Rookie. Always trying to prove himself. Near ruined him when black ops shut down.
Took to drowning his sorrows in the nearest cantina. Sobered up quick when I told him about the Bastion.
Surely we can do better than some washed-up drunk.
Doesn't sound professional.
Kid's not washed up. Just misses the work. Besides, he's brilliant.
The sergeant wasn't assigned to black ops by accident.
Arlos must show promise.
Lorant's find. Caught him hacking into his own service record.
Is anyone in black ops a normal, functioning adult?
Your entire team is pathetic.
We've all got our weaknesses, my lord. And our strengths.
Arlos could barely aim a blaster when he joined black ops. We gave him strength to go with his smarts.
Made sergeant after our last assault. Could be up for a commission, if things go smooth at the Bastion.
Advancing his career won't improve your own.
What do you care?
Didn't know it needed improving, my lord.
Your victory will depend on his performance.
His role is crucial.
The Bastion could become your greatest failure.
Let's say they don't.
Only if we all die. Won't matter much then.
The Bastion's got some serious security. Alarms, cameras, turrets, the works. Anyone could get around them, it's Arlos.
Heard from the kid a few days ago. Said he had some intel ready. Sounded more jittery than ever. We'll find out why.
....but I can't account for cheap Republic shortcuts! Who uses a closed circuit system? In the Bastion, no less!
Heard better excuses from my assault rifle. Did you even get their schematics?
No. Yes. Partly. I have the ground floor layout. That should get you all the way to central command.
And what surprises will we find there? That's supposed to be your job, Arlos.
If this is black ops strategy, I'm not impressed.
Pierce is right.
But if you could see their code, my lord, not to mention their wiring--
To come so close, and stumble at the finish.
This is priceless.
Perhaps Pierce could offer you some support.
Can we help?
I wouldn't give him water on Tatooine.
I'm starting to think we were shut down for a reason. And the reason was you.
There's something else I could try. It's risky--but I'd get full control of their systems.
The Bastion will be ours before we even step inside. Just give me another chance.
Hope so. You screw this up, and I'll personally take it out of your hide. Now get back to work.
Schematics look good. With full control, Republic won't have a chance. Kid did all right.
Never tell him that, of course. Might make him sloppy. Got to keep him on his toes.
No officer in the Empire would accept his failure.
A firm hand is best.
No Sith lord, either. Might be Arlos' head if he doesn't learn.
Sergeant Arlos did well, given the circumstances.
Go easy on the boy.
Galaxy's not all sunshine and stars. Kid's got to learn that now.
You said security was the team's last concern.
Is that everything?
Prepwork's finished. The team's ready. Soon as General Rakton gives the order, we strike.
Just hope it's soon. Can't wait to see those Republic flags burn.
Plans for the Bastion assault are coming along. Tanido's got the weapon ready. But having the right ordinance is just the start.
Gotta worry about numbers, too. That's Lorant's job. Captain Lorant, now. Connections got her a good post on Balmorra.
Bend the rules a lot in black ops. Lorant could always smooth things out. Pretty face, way with words...people like her.
High praise, coming from a man like you.
That includes you.
Just stating the facts. Others might say more.
I imagine Tanido doesn't make many friends.
Better than Tanido.
Lorant's got certain assets Tanido doesn't.
What is Lorant's role in the Bastion assault?
And that's useful?
Reinforcements, from the right places.
Lorant's a favorite of Moff Galvan. Close to retirement now, but he could give us an army if he had the mind.
Asked Lorant about our chances. Seemed to think she could convince the old man, with the right favors.
If Moff Galvan refuses, I'll tell him to reconsider.
That's not necessary.
Don't think you'd like his terms.
How did Lorant become Moff Galvan's favorite?
What kind of favors?
I thought black ops was an elite organization.
How disgusting.
We can't all have the Force, my lord.
Lorant spent an evening with Moff Galvan as a lieutenant. By morning, she was a captain.
...there has to be another way. Moff Galvan has resources, but what he's asking is impossible.
The favors I would have to give him now... it would be above and beyond the call of duty.
Never stopped you before, Captain.
The old man's depraved! And the years have not been kind to him.
Desperate times call for desperate measures, Captain.
Pierce has a point.
Not this desperate, my lord. Not when I can provide alternatives.
This is the Bastion. Farm-fresh cadets and refurbished artillery won't help us here.
This kind of coercion is beneath an Imperial officer.
I disapprove of this.
A youthful mistake, my lord. One I would rather not repeat.
You're lucky Moff Galvan's even interested. Hear he's more into Twi'leks these days.
Surely Moff Galvan wasn't your first promotion.
Any other "friends?"
No, the others were earned. Like any good Imperial officer.
You were black ops once, before that commission went to your head. Remember?
We do what's necessary to get the job done. Some of us more than others.
I'll comm Moff Galvan. Reinforcements will be ready when the time comes.
Wouldn't want to be Lorant right now.
You should have spared her from these...favors.
That was cruel.
It's for the Bastion. No time to lose your nerve.
The Captain made her bed. Now she must lie in it.
She started this.
With Moff Galvan. There's an image I didn't need.
You have your men. Are you ready for the assault?
It's done now.
Security's our last problem. The Bastion will have plenty of systems.
Black ops had a man for that too. Let you know when I find him.
Best to start with Lieutenant Tanido. Weapons man. Could turn a hyperdrive into a gun turret if he wanted.
Lets it all go to his head, of course. Can't open his mouth except to brag about black ops and our wins.
What purpose will he serve in the Bastion assault?
What are his skills?
Only way inside the Bastion is the gate. Supposedly impenetrable. Tanido swore he could break through.
I assume he has the talent to back up his talk.
Maybe he's justified.
Tanido's a genius. The Bastion will only make him worse.
That's all I've heard since you joined my crew.
Sounds familiar.
Noted. Keep my comments to the weather from now on.
Took a while to track Tanido down, but he's stationed on Hoth. Finally got a clear comm signal today.
You're welcome to listen in. After a few months defrosting blasters, Tanido's probably in rare form.
...and then, he had me forcibly removed from the armory. Over a few flash grenades! Weaponsmaster, indeed.
And after you calibrated all the assault rifles for him too. Shame about those cadets, though.
Yes, that was unfortunate. But how was I to know those rifles were for training? They really should use slaves!
Anyway, that's how I ended up on Hoth. Scraping ice from blaster barrels and reheating ammunition. Pathetic.
The Empire must maintain control on Hoth.
The work is necessary.
A second class private could do my work. Or a particularly intelligent wampa.
On Korriban, we use certain officers for target practice.
It could be worse.
Then again, Hoth has its charms. The ice crystals form some marvelous patterns.
A man of your talent should be on Dromund Kaas.
You deserve better.
Maybe you should start tinkering again. Get that weapon you built for the Bastion out of storage.
You know very well that weapon's finished. It's waiting for the assault that will never happen.
The lieutenant volunteered your entire team.
Pierce made it happen.
You may have to find another genius, Pierce.
If you're not interested....
You're serious? It's not that I doubted the Empire. It's just been so long....
I much prefer you cold and miserable on Hoth.
Be thankful you're wrong.
What my lord means to say is that we understand, if you can't leave your work.
We've got clearance from General Rakton. The Bastion's ours for the taking.
Then it's fallen into place. The Bastion... after all these years.
I'll get back to base and start making arrangements. When I have the weapon, I'll contact you.
Tanido doesn't like to waste time. He'll have that weapon quick as a mynock's wings.
Just in time, too. Let the man idle any longer and he might do some real damage.
Lieutenant Tanido needs to learn his place.
Don't encourage him.
Little confidence never hurt anyone. Present company included.
You have your weapons man. What's next?
What happens now?
I look forward to seeing Tanido unleashed.
He's a brilliant man.
Should be a show. Like to see the size of his head after this one.
Tanido's weapon will help, but we'll need more than firepower for this one.
Assault this big takes reinforcements too. Get back to you about those.
My lord. Glad we have a moment. Something we need to discuss.
Got a message from General Rakton. You might have heard of him--most decorated commander in the Empire.
Seems the Empire's set their sights on Corellia. They want black ops leading the charge. Me and the old team.
Tell General Rakton you serve me, not him.
He is out of line.
First thing I said, honest. General told me he'd risk it.
He could command anyone in the Empire.
Why black ops?
I've seen you work. Your skills are impressive.
I understand why.
Put the team together. Then you'll see some fireworks.
Corellia's the real deal. Core world. One of the Republic's founders. Gonna take more than the latest batch of recruits to claim it.
Black ops soldiers use their brains. General asked for strategy. Told him we could take the planet with one target--the Bastion.
You and your team may be the most qualified.
You are the experts.
Ready, willing and able. We've been planning this assault for years.
Surely there are other, more important targets.
Try to be objective.
No one's interested in your pathetic last mission.
Not this again.
Has nothing to do with that. Makes tactical sense.
The Bastion's the center of operations for the entire Republic military. We'd be cutting their legs out from under them.
The Republic's plans fall apart. Morale disappears. By the time they get their cannoks in a row, Corellia will be ours.
Conquering the Bastion may give us more than Corellia.
This sounds important.
Sure. A place in history. Black ops' place in history.
How will you prepare?
Lot of planning. Gonna need weapons, reinforcements, tech....
My mission is far more important than any military exercise.
I don't have time for this.
Won't affect my duties here. Won't affect you at all.
My team can handle the preparations. General Rakton will give us the order. All I'd need is your leave.
Inform the General that you have my blessing.
Permission granted.
Yes, my lord. Thank you, my lord.
It's been a long time since your black ops days.
If you're ready.
Some things you never forget.
We'll see how your preparations turn out.
Impress me first.
You won't be disappointed, my lord.
First step's tracking down the old team. Could be at the four corners of the galaxy by now.
It'll take some time. Let you know who I find later.
Know I've said this before, but I kept my mouth shut a while now. Time to speak up.
Quinn betrayed us once. Long as he's alive, he could do it again. Puts the whole crew at risk.
I rely on you to inform me of anything suspicious.
You're my guarantee.
Good. Quinn won't go to the 'fresher without me knowing.
You may hate Quinn, but you and the crew are perfectly safe.
Don't be afraid.
Hard to serve with a man you don't trust.
Ask me to kill Quinn again, and I may kill you instead.
Don't question me.
Noted. Just think we've got enough problems.
Quinn's dead weight. Can't do anything without his approval. He's slowing us both down.
I prefer Quinn's discipline to your reckless defiance.
At least he's not sloppy.
What gets the job done? Guarantee it's not rules and regulations.
Salute the captain and move on. The only command you need obey is mine.
You can ignore Quinn.
Appreciate it. Just want to give a hundred and ten percent here.
Quinn is your superior. Answer to him or you answer to me.
Learn to deal with it.
Noted. Just hope it doesn't come back to bite us.
Wrong crew can make or break a mission. In black ops, everyone knows their job and does it. No room for screwups.
We were the go-to squad. Assassination of Moff Tarrick? The massacre at Haruun Kal? Operation Force Crush? All us.
The rest of your team must fight like you.
I can believe that.
What happened to your black ops team?
What changed?
Treaty of Coruscant. Black ops was disbanded, everyone reassigned. Dumb move.
You haven't got the skill to pull all that off.
That's impossible.
Ask around the Empire. Our reputation's solid.
Good team, hitting the right targets--we were gearing up for some serious assaults before we were shut down.
Like the Bastion. Huge Republic military complex on Corellia. They say it can't be taken. We would have done it.
The Empire will reach the Bastion eventually.
Your chance may come.
Need clearance, first. And the rest of the team to pull it off.
Sounds like an ideal target for the Empire.
Why didn't they try?
Corellia's one of the Republic's founding planets. Could never get close.
I have no interest in your lost hopes and dreams.
Please, spare me.
Should get back to work. Bent your ear about this long enough.
Every friend I commed to brag about this post has already heard of you.
Never served under a Sith Lord before. Not sure how promotion works. Heard a few tales, though.
It's kill or be killed. You can always be replaced.
The strongest wins.
How do you think things are done on Korriban?
Like what?
Seems like there's one way to make it and a hundred ways to screw up.
No mere soldier can grasp the power of the Force.
You can't understand.
Fired some pretty big blasters. Try me.
Might have been easy to get this far. Might have been a war. Either way, good story.
I've killed rivals every step of the way.
A lot of people had to die.
Good move. Might betray you, frame you, even kill you.
Picture the worst and then double it.
Use your imagination.
Bet you've had to keep your eyes open the whole way.
Not so different from the military. Cross the wrong people and they assign you to some graveyard swamp like Taris.
That post was a dead end. Got out by threatening to blab about Moff Hurdenn's Rodian mistress.
You discovered Moff Hurdenn's weakness and exploited it.
Impressive.
To get here. Best career move I've made yet.
I'm surprised Moff Hurdenn put himself in that position.
You blackmailed him?
His fault. Too soft to kill me when he realized.
Blackmail me, and your reassignment will be permanent.
I'd have killed you.
Don't worry. Dead men don't get promoted.
My affairs are no business of yours.
One you'll never know.
Noted. Won't ask again.
When we're back on the ship, we should talk.
Can't talk now.
Now it's got her putting on airs. Actually ordered me to comm her. Better get to it, eh?
Got a few leads on the old black ops team. Republic won't let the Bastion go easy. It'll take all of us to claim it.
Oh, if only! The Citadel would be a welcome sight after all this snow and ice--
I'd like to talk when you get a moment.
My lord.
Good hunting.
As you command, my lord.
I'm steady and sure in all situations, my lord.
Like your style, my lord.
Don't worry, I know my limits.
You won't be disappointed.
I'll prove my worth to you, my lord.
Just say the word. I'll show you what I can do.
You won't be disappointed, my lord.
